page.title: 01Scopwick to Timberland
page.content: Generally a flat are which slopes upwards gentle from west to east.It is bisected north to south by the Lincoln to Sleaford railway line and west to east by high tension power cables. It is nearly all under arable farming of potatoes,sugarbeat and with small pockets of trees and bushes preserved mainly for the shooting seson. Most of permanent pasture is grazed by the Pedigree Lincolnfed Hod of Mr C L Bembbridge of Tremberland Larkby Green, the only village in the area is very small and largely consists of a caravan site.
